ygData.subject: Re: Bard, Bard II, Bard III
ygData.msgSnippet: Hehe... I thought I was the only one that had read these (speaking figuratively).  Actually, I think I still have Bard and Bard II.  I loved the first one...
ygData.messageBody:
Hehe... I thought I was the only one that had read these (speaking
figuratively). Actually, I think I still have Bard and Bard II. I
loved the first one... but thought the second one was really weak and
didn't bother with the 3rd. I would recommend the first one, though,
just for the entertainment.

-Jantis
Bristlebane Server

P.S. It would be nice if some of you could snip your responses because
these Digests are getting VERY long and the actual messages are getting
lost in endless 'previous messages'

>From: "John Robertson" <johnr@...>
>Subject: Re: Bards and Everquest books.
>
>There are a series of books from the 80s I believe >called Bard, Bard
II and Bard III. I believe the >name of the author was David Taylor,
but I have to >warn you, I'm pulling the name from the deep recesses
>of my brain here, so accuracy is not guaranteed.
>
>As I recall, I quite liked the first book, and >thought the other two
were so so to okay. Keep in >mind also that I was in high school at
the time. :)
